intro: Smithia domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
